The next Biennial should take place in 2020 and will showcase work by fifteen artists selected by a jury comprising Felicity Hammond, Samer ElSohrab, Akram Karimi, and Barnaby J. Henry. The theme of the exhibition will be “The Greater West,” focusing on the idea that the “West is where the future of humanity lies.”The 2019 edition of the biennial, “The Dark Tower,” showcased [Priya] Ramchandani’s work, “The Light,” a series of photographs that depict the solar system as a vast, interconnected network of interconnected glassed chambers populated by humanoid life forms, as well as the two‐dimensional environments in which they are recorded. The exhibition was curated by artist Adam Arkadi, and the biennial is organized by the American artist and curator Anthony Kiedy.
